name: milkshake
text:
why would T run the disposal?
that's too funny.

name: riazm
text: I assumed he was running the old shirt through it.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
I don't know about that. Sometimes I come home, step into my kitchen and notice a smell, but I can't tell where it's coming from: trash? fridge? sink? If it ain't the first two, I normally just run the garbage disposal for a minute and put some Dawn down there, hoping that might work.

I've always thought Teodor had a similar knee-jerk reaction to a horrible smell: run the disposal, just in case it helps.

name: bobothebum
text: I always thought he was attempting to grind up the tangible terror that floated about in the air as a result of Lyle's whatnots.

name: biznart
text:
That was my interpretation, and I often do the same in that situation.

Orange peel gives off a nice citrus-y scent when it hits the blades, but it's not a practical solution unless you've eaten an orange recently.

name: biznart
text:
And had I read two comments down before replying, I would have seen this wasn't necessary.

I apologize for wasting everyone's time with the above comment and then again with this one apologizing.

name: lexsenthur
text:
FUN HOME REMEDY FOR ILL SMELLS:

Put orange rinds in the garbage disposal and run it. Makes your house smell of small times, when oranges were a reward and not an obligation.

name: woodenteeth
text: lexsenthur, my brain just filled with smells of small times such is the power of olfactory association! chubby for you.

name: dusty
text: for you small times smelled like orange peel? For me they mostly smelled like a paper mill.

name: ganymedeio
text: The business cat is from Rougher Times.

name: nephilim8
text: The business cat is from circumstances.

name: aelindil
text: Your words are balm on a tired soul.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: A comment left by untilyouaresonude was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by apocowarg, Thorfinn, NDCaesar, Siah)

name: gothfae
text: Is it bad that this strip has often caused me to wonder what this would be like?

name: a_dude
text: it truly is best to avoid perinea mouth.

name: delzhand
text:
I have to admit, I really don't get the joke in the last panel. Wikipedia tells me that taleggio is a kind of cheese, so...

?

name: mira
text: The older bear is telling his younger bear friend that although he enjoys his bowl, he does not enjoy smells and tastes so bad they cause a stinky cheese to run for cover.

name: geysershitdick
text: when cheese gets old it gets hella ammoniated

name: mysterymeat1001
text: Specifically, it's washed-rind cheeses, which smell dubious even at peak ripeness. Think Limburger cheese here.

name: mastronaut
text: The Colonel knows his cheese.

name: twohundredninety
text:
Oh dude . That makes sense now. For some reason I always thought "that would make an ammoniated Taleggio etc." was modifying "avoidance."

I was all, "why would old cheese avoid contact with perinea?"

name: farqussus
text: Yeah, ha, I mean cheese and perinea are bestest buds from old times. Silly.

name: mrphaethon
text: Sometimes I suspect Cornelius is just being a dick.  No one really needs the plural of "perineum".

name: hollis
text: Yes, but Téodor shares (to some extent) Cornelius' intellectual bent (see Onstad's interview in Orato: http://www.orato.com/node/2332 ), so maybe Cornelius doesn't employ the vocabulary filter with him.

name: johnnylandmine
text: Obviously, Cornelius did. Imagine not knowing the plural of "perineum" and then finding yourself in this situation. Mr. Bear is not a dick; Mr. Bear is grammatically forearmed .

name: presterjohn
text: Correctly pluralizing the medical names of bathing suit areas is really the only tangible benefit of learning Latin these days.

name: pogo
text: The naughty bits.

name: djwhiterabbit
text:
'how untoward!' is a rather calm reaction for such a happening, even for cornelius.

i would like to see a comparison of how each achewood character would verablly react under similar distress.

name: semiquaver
text: You're sick . But I like the way you think.

name: soticoto
text:
I'd like to see Philippe's reaction most of all...
... followed by Ultra Peanut's reaction to Philippe's reaction.

name: clembot
text: it's not often that you see the plural of perineum

name: zyrelax
text: Why is this not a 5 for the line "teabagged it until his eyes watered" alone?

name: thisdoggisproice
text: You say he dipped his gooch in my bowl?  BETTER SMELL IT.

name: darthemed
text: Mr. Cornelius Bear: King of Words.

name: connellingus
text: Cornelius's class and wordplay really made a great bit out of the previous strip's crass gag.

name: jack
text:
Notice that Cornelius qualifies his "mouth's reputation for vigilant avoidance of perinea." I try to keep ANY perinea out of my mouth, even if they aren't particularly terrible.

Would there be a type of perinea he wouldn't avoid?

name: fidget
text:
I too, noticed this modification. I imagine, however, that Cornelius is open-minded enough to not totally dismiss the idea of his mouth meeting (or having met) a perineum or two in its day. He did work for the SPICE channel, and won the Bad Ass Games.

(If my syntax here is a bit convoluted, I apologize, it is the wine)

name: rolotonybrowntown
text: wine completely hates syntax

name: fidget
text: but syntax luuhrves wine

name: saru
text: I actually make a habit of seeking out certain perinea. Pretty much exclusively attractive female perinea.

name: saru
text: Note that you may make your own decision on the arrangement of modifiers there.

name: nikopol
text: Man, Cornelius flat DESTROYS Teodor here. But then again Cornelius is the strip's established Badass.

name: echidnaboy
text: That is a good reputation for a mouth to have.

name: lawbot
text: This sums up housemates.

name: sciencey
text:
Cornelius didn't say that he avoids ALL perinea, just perinea that is so nasty that it scares stinky cheese.

I'm sure he enjoys himself some good perinea on occasion.

name: semiquaver
text: That's some goooooooooood perinea.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
with your winking icon,
that's pretty terrible.

name: boredom_man
text: Now it's... different!

name: semiquaver
text:
I need a change.

A delicious, delicious change.

name: heccibiggs
text: I love your new avatar. I can stare at it for ages.

name: ham_shoes
text: Cornelius is not like other bears. Bears that would eat out of a garbage can, or a dead cow's ribcage, or that bowl

name: norsef
text:
No, not even a frothing hermit grizzly would go near that bowl.
Otherwise they would never have survived to evolve.

name: mtrott
text: Ah yes, but he is not a bear. He is an alive stuffed animal.

name: nokidding
text: this is my favorite specimen of alt-text so far produced.
